title: Tourists Find Suspicious Packet In Ocean, It Turns Out To Be 20Kg Of Cocaine Worth Rs 4.26 Cr
text:
Tourists Find Suspicious Packet In Ocean, It Turns Out To Be 20Kg Of Cocaine Worth Rs 4.26 Cr

Tourists Find Suspicious Packet In Ocean, It Turns Out To Be 20Kg Of Cocaine Worth Rs 4.26 Cr

A family was walking along Fripp Island, South Carolina when they caught a big package which was wrapped in a trash bag in the ocean. They then took it to their rental home and opened it up just to find about 20 kilos of cocaine.

Beaufort County Sheriff Major Bob Bromage told Associated Press that the family was walking along Fripp Island when they spotted this bag floating in the water. They dragged it onto the beach and took it to their rental home, later discovering it to be bricks of white powder. They decided to call the police at that time.

AP

Authorities took the white powder and assessed that the cocaine’s value was more than Rs 4.26 crore ($ 600,000). Officials are still figuring out where this bag come from.

Bromage said narcotics don’t frequently wash up in the county. He thinks Hurricane Dorian may have pushed it ashore.
